definition: Jin Dynasty (265-420)
surname Jin/the Jin Dynasties (265-420)/Western Jin 西晉|西晋[Xi1 Jin4] (265-316), Eastern Jin 東晉|东晋[Dong1 Jin4] (317-420) and Later Jin Dynasty (936-946)/short name for Shanxi province 山西[Shan1 xi1]
to move forward/to promote/to advance
abbr. for 朝鮮|朝鲜[Chao2 xian3] Korea
imperial or royal court/government/dynasty/reign of a sovereign or emperor/court or assembly held by a sovereign or emperor/to make a pilgrimage to/facing/towards
morning

sentences.english: During the Jin dynasty, a boy, called Mao Bao, was born into an impoverished family.
sentences.chinese: 晉朝時，有一位名叫毛寶的小男孩，家境十分貧困。

sentences.english: Huangshan in the Jin dynasty, when Buddhism introduced, under the peak Regulus Regulus temple was built.
sentences.chinese: 佛教在晉朝時傳入黃山，軒轅峯下曾建有軒­轅古剎。

sentences.english: D. 265-420), but the Jin could not long contain the invasions of the nomadic peoples.
sentences.chinese: 但是，晉朝並不能長期抵制遊牧民族的入侵。

sentences.english: In Jin Dynasty, there was a person named Yue Guang, who always entertained his guests with wine.
sentences.chinese: 晉朝的時候，有一個叫樂廣的人很喜歡請朋友喝酒。

definition: Jin Dynasty (265-420)
Qi of Southern dynasties (479-502)
Song of the Southern dynasties 南朝宋 (420-479), with capital at Nanjing

Bamboo Annals, early chronicle of Chinese ancient history, written c. 300 BC
Sima Yan (236-290), founding emperor of Jin dynasty 晋 after the Three Kingdoms period, reigned 265-290 as Emperor Wu of Jin 晉武帝
Liu Yuan, warlord at the end of the Western Jin dynasty 西晋, founder of Cheng Han of the Sixteen Kingdoms 成漢|成汉 (304-347)
Gu Kaizhi or Ku K'aichih (346-407), famous painter of Eastern Jin dynasty, one of the Four Great Painters of the Six Dynasties 六朝四大家
Spring and Autumn Period (770-476 BC)
Tao Zongyi (c. 1329-1410), Yuan dynasty scholar
Lu Ji (261-303), Chinese writer and literary critic
Fu Jian (338-385), emperor of Former Qin 前秦[Qian2 Qin2], reigning from 357-385

History of the Early Tang Dynasty, sixteenth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Liu Xu 劉昫|刘昫[Liu2 Xu4] in 945 during Later Jin 後晉|后晋[Hou4 Jin4] of the Five Dynasties, 200 scrolls
